# 8 Reasons to Update Your Website
> In today's world, the face of your business is online. We're outlining several reasons it's critical to update your website and keep your content fresh and relevant. 1. First Impressions. First impressions are everything.&nbsp;Your website can often serve as your&hellip;

Full Content:
In today's world, the face of your business is online. We're outlining several reasons it's critical to update your website and keep your content fresh and relevant.



1. First Impressions.



First impressions are everything.&nbsp;Your website can often serve as your customersâ€™ first impression of your business. In fact, 75% of consumers admit to making judgments on a companyâ€™s credibility based on the companyâ€™s website design.&nbsp; Whoa.&nbsp; Is your site visually appealing to your customers? Did you design it with your users in mind? There are design elements that increase your website conversions and provide the best user experience (UX) possible. Use them!



2. Quick Decisions.



Not only is design important, but the speed at which your page loads can also impact customersâ€™ opinions about your site and your business.&nbsp;Users take about 0.05 seconds to form their opinion about a website after it loads.&nbsp;We recognized the first impression factor already, but here we want to emphasize the speed at which they make this decision.&nbsp;It has been found that 53% of mobile users will leave a website if it takes more than 3 seconds to load.&nbsp;Users leaving your site will result in a high bounce rate (and lower Google ranking.) We outline ways to increase the load speed of your website (enhancing UX.)&nbsp;



3. CTA - Call To Actions.



First impressions combined with quick decisions require an effective CTA (Call To Action). Think of this as the â€˜main purposeâ€™ of your site. What actions do you want your customers to take?&nbsp;Do you want to get a phone call or an email? Are you trying to sell a product or service? This CTA should be front and center, and with a solid first impression and great user experience, your website will support your business.



4. Job Seekers.



Job seekers also form opinions of your company based on your website.Â  59% of candidates visit the company website after discovering a job opportunity.Â Generating prospective employees is a tough task.Â Itâ€™s important to showcase your company in the right light to the right candidates.Â 



5. Simplified Content.



Your website answers the "5Wâ€™s" (who, what when, where, why) and more. 55% of readers spend less than 15 seconds on a page. Readers can take in only so much information at a time, so itâ€™s important to provide these answers in a digestible way.&nbsp;Making complex things simple is actually very difficult.&nbsp;Pixauraâ€™s team of marketers expertly help with this task, leaving you with a user friendly, impressively designed website.



6. Search Engine Optimization - SEO.



Google will find your website if it is published.&nbsp;Search Engine Optimization (SEO) helps Google distinguish who would want to find your site upon searching, and then shows it to them.&nbsp;This is incredibly important because 93% of online experiences start with a search engine. SEO is more than just keyword tracking.&nbsp;Websites are constructed like buildings. They need a solid architecture, with things like title tags, meta descriptions and even Local SEO, which helps Google find local businesses upon searches. We offer a Free SEO audit of an existing website to examine your current SEO efforts.



7. Analytics &amp; CRO - Conversion Rate Optimization.



Building a website and monitoring its performance can provide insights that may impact your marketing (and even your entire business's) decisions.&nbsp;A website built with analytics enabled is critical for measurement.&nbsp;After you have visitors/leads to your site, are you converting them into sales? Or are the people bouncing (yes, this is a real term to indicate someone visited your site and left immediately)? Our team uses Google Analytics' landing page data to increase conversion rate optimization.&nbsp;



8. Security, Analysis, and Adjustments.



Security updates should be a regular practice for website owners and hosts.&nbsp;Prevent hacking or blacklisting by working with a reputable company that cares about the security of your website. After your site is built and is secure, itâ€™s crucial to analyze the data and make decisions about the effectiveness of your design and content. Are the viewers dropping off at certain points along the web journey? This is a very important (and fun) part of monitoring new and existing websites.







How We Fit In



At Pixaura, we think of ourselves as an extension of your marketing team, with developers and marketers all working together to help your business thrive online.&nbsp;For more information or to discuss an update to your website design or digital marketing campaigns, drop us a line. Weâ€™d love to hear from you!

We're outlining several reasons it's critical to update your website and keep your content fresh and relevant. 1. First Impressions. First impressions are everything.&nbsp;Your website can often serve as your&hellip;

Full Content:
It's Wye Oak Wednesday here at Pixaura. Well, here in my home office, I should say. The team's all spread out these days! Excuse me for sounding like a teenager, but this is my favorite band. No joke, I'm sitting here wearing a Wye Oak shirt, writing in a Wye Oak notebook.



I found Wye Oak's video for their song "Fish" in 2011, and instantly fell in love with their music. Although they have grown and transcended genre over the years, their sound remains uniquely identifiable. Side note: they chose their name in reference to the former official tree of their home state, Maryland.



They're even better live! 



I've been fortunate enough to see them twice at Louisville's Zanzibar, and on two other occasions at the Southgate House Revival, just outside Cincinnati. If their tour comes near me, you can trust I'll be there!

# Optimize Your Online Presence with Local SEO
> Digital Marketing is an umbrella term for a complex puzzle consisting of pieces -- all connecting back to your website.&nbsp;The more consistent the pieces are, the more stable and secure your puzzle will be (aka, more sales and leads from&hellip;

Full Content:
Digital Marketing is an umbrella term for a complex puzzle consisting of pieces -- all connecting back to your website.&nbsp;The more consistent the pieces are, the more stable and secure your puzzle will be (aka, more sales and leads from your website and digital marketing.)&nbsp;So, how do you optimize your online presence? How do you ensure your physical locations show up in local rankings?



We have answers. 



Pixaura has a team of marketers and developers that have experience tying all of these pieces together. A well-known piece of the digital marketing puzzle is SEO (Search Engine Optimization.)Â We elaborate on the topic here, and below are a fewÂ Local SEO tipsÂ you can use to ensure youâ€™re in the best position to be found online by searchersÂ in your area:




Check your Google My Business page for correct information, and continue (or begin) making posts on your page



Make sure your Name, Address, and Phone number (frequently referred to as NAP) are consistent across search engines



Improve your rating withÂ online reviews



Consider advertising your services in Google and other search engines



Evaluate your current Local SEO status by simply entering only your business name and zip code to receive your complimentary Local SEO report directly from our website.




Solving the Puzzle



Regardless of the size of your business, linking all of the puzzle pieces together takes a solid strategy and a lot of time.&nbsp;A few key steps for building local citations will help you optimize your online presence. If we can help you manage this puzzle, you can focus on what you do best. And we consider that a win-win.&nbsp; Letâ€™s win together!&nbsp;Contact us&nbsp;today.

# Improving SEO Score and Site Speed
> A solid strategy for moving your company higher in search results is by improving your SEO score and site speed. In terms of ranking, Google will use Lighthouse. In terms of UX, Google Analytics should be considered. They both play&hellip;

Full Content:
A solid strategy for moving your company higher in search results is by improving your SEO score and site speed.



In terms of ranking, Google will use Lighthouse.



In terms of UX, Google Analytics should be considered.



They both play an important role in ranking in different ways and are influenced by different factors. I would say that UX is the greater factor between the two, as Google focuses on providing the greatest user experience per query.



Lighthouse is also easier to manipulate as all of the pings come out of a single server and predictable location. As a result, this makes it far easier to optimize. UX is a globally encompassing aspect, as users can access your site from on-page links, SERP's, videos, and direct URL searches. Therefore, the traffic acquisition within UX is far broader, and more difficult to manipulate, producing a far more reflective load time.



Having a poor UX load time will also be far more impactful for ranking than a poor Lighthouse load time, as it will increase your domain's bounce rate.



5 ways to Improve your SEO Score



Publish quality content that is relevant Publish quality content on a regular basisGive attention to the metadata on your page, i.e., headings, descriptions, keywordsUse descriptive links on your page, and ensure you are linking to both internal and external pagesDescribe your visual and video media with alt tags to ensure search engines can find them



Improving your SEO score is a long game, but it's worth the effort. Being found by searchers is the goal, and SEO is the method. Need help getting started? Pixaura's experts will build your customized SEO strategy. 



Get our Free SEO Audit report and get an idea where your site stands for page speed and website SEO.



5 Ways to Improve your Site Speed



Enable compression for CSS, HTML, and JavaScript filesReduce page redirectsLeverage browser caching to reduce loading timeEnsure your server has adequate memory and fast query responseOptimize images - use the correct file type and compress their size



Pixaura works with our clients to build and maintain their websites. Our experts ensure your website pages load quickly, and with quality content. Need help building or improving your website? Drop us a line.

Important notes:
- Published on: 2020-05-11 13:37:00
- Category: Posts
- [Improving SEO Score and Site Speed](https://www.pixaura.com/seo-score-and-site-speed/): A solid strategy for moving your company higher in search results is by improving your SEO score and site speed. In terms of ranking, Google will use Lighthouse. In terms of UX, Google Analytics should be considered. They both play&hellip;

# 6 Reasons Your Business Needs Instagram
> If I told you there was a platform with over a billion users, would you be interested? I'm really hoping you said yes. The Instagram platform trails only Facebook for number of users, presenting an enormous opportunity for your business.&hellip;

Full Content:
If I told you there was a platform with over a billion users, would you be interested? I'm really hoping you said yes. The Instagram platform trails only Facebook for number of users, presenting an enormous opportunity for your business. Let's take a look at 6 reasons your business needs Instagram.



Instagram Users are Very Active



This social media network isn't populated with individuals who sign up but then rarely log in. A recent study found that 38% of IG's users check the app multiple times EACH DAY. User engagement is 10x higher than Facebook, in large part a result of the organic nature of Instagram. Generally, you don't have to hunt for followers. If you post quality content, they will find you. And as more users follow you, you'll be suggested to more users. Followers beget followers, basically. Unlike Facebook, Instagram users follow businesses all the time - 80% of users willingly connected to a brand in 2017.



The Demographics of Instagram



Almost half the U.S. population is on Instagram. Clearly, that is too large a market segment to ignore. Of these 120+ million users, 64% are between the ages of 18-34, with another 25% between the ages of 35-54. These age ranges comprise the active consumer segment of the U.S. economy. Be visible to them!



Selling on Instagram



While Instagram is notoriously a visual platform, there are opportunities for businesses to make money. 72% of Instagram users have purchased products through Instagram. This presents a huge opportunity for businesses of any size. Brands can tag items for sale in their posts, and link to their store. Also, there's a well-developed ability to run advertisements in multiple formats and with advanced targeting options. In addition, the ad manager offers detailed tracking reports so you can effectively gauge your ROI.



Tell Your Brand's Story



Instagram gives businesses the opportunity to create a themed feed. Think of your Instagram page as a home page - it's important for the pictures to fit together. The look of this overall feed outweighs the aesthetics of any one image. Regardless of your industry, there is something unique about your brand - showcase that! You could be a florist or a plumber, and there will still be a way to beautify what you do and communicate your message. Show off your personality or your culture. Highlight new products, your team, your events - the opportunities are endless.



Tag, You're It



Hashtags are like keywords, and they serve to increase your brand's visibility. They make you searchable and findable, get you noticed, earn you followers, and increase clicks to your site. Developing a branded hashtag is a big bonus; creating an actionable one is even better. Also, Instagram provides the option for location tagging, allowing users to post photos related to your place of business. That's free advertising!



User Engagement



The Instagram platform helps you effectively engage with customers. In addition to providing visual content, Instagram makes it easy to respond to questions or comments. This humanizes your business, leading to trust and a better customer experience. Stories make your business relatable; behind-the-scenes shots, employee highlights, and live Q&amp;A's are a great way to connect with your followers.



Pixaura 



Finally, stay cognizant of why users are there. People donâ€™t go on Instagram to read or see advertisements. People go on IG to see pretty pictures, to connect, to engage. And in today's marketplace, it's important to give your customers an engaging experience across multiple platforms. Your business needs Instagram! If you need help developing your social media strategy, Pixaura can help.

I'm really hoping you said yes. The Instagram platform trails only Facebook for number of users, presenting an enormous opportunity for your business.&hellip;

# Marketing During a Crisis
> DEVELOPING AN INTERIM STRATEGY This is a difficult time for everyone, and for you, a difficult decision: marketing during a crisis. How should you do it? Should you at all? All that time you spent on your marketing strategy -&hellip;

Full Content:
DEVELOPING AN INTERIM STRATEGY



This is a difficult time for everyone, and for you, a difficult decision: marketing during a crisis. How should you do it? Should you at all?



All that time you spent on your marketing strategy - well, itâ€™s useless now.&nbsp;Was that too harsh? Okay, I'm sorry. It wonâ€™t be useful for a while. Better?



Itâ€™s time to pivot, and quickly. This pandemic has changed everything, and your marketing needs to change with it.&nbsp;



Strategy: Where To Start



Begin by determining what your business goals are today and how they have changed. If you had to adjust your business model to the current climate, you need to update your audience. If youâ€™re offering the same services, itâ€™s a good idea to announce that as well. More than ever, your marketing content needs to be reflective of where your business is.&nbsp;



Marketing Content: Timely Or Timeless?



Next, determine how much you want to â€œlean inâ€ to whatâ€™s happening. Time-sensitive marketing has real value - relevant content can bring you into conversations that are already occurring. On the other hand, content that is timeless will bring you traffic now AND down the road. At Pixaura, we recommend you use both types of content.



(Side note: the COVID crisis prompted this post. It will not be the only event that necessitates analyzing and adjusting your marketing strategy. Bad news will continue to come, and itâ€™s important to remember that even if your business wasnâ€™t directly affected, your audience almost certainly was.)



Your Audience: Find Them



Speaking of your audience, who are they? Where are they? People are online more than ever, but they are behaving in different ways. You may even discover brand new eyes on your content - what led them to you now? As always, itâ€™s necessary to adjust your marketing strategy in order to reach your target audience.



Finally, determine what you want actions you want this audience to take. Is your marketing now informational, or still conversion-driven? Set short-term goals that are realistic and measurable, and ensure your content is congruent.



Be Visible: Donâ€™t Disappear



Regardless of the changes to your strategy, keep marketing! Studies have shown that â€œgoing dark,â€ even during a crisis, results in a significant decline in brand awareness. Keep interacting, keep pushing out new content, keep building your reputation. Be authentic and empathetic while maintaining your brandâ€™s tone and perspective. 



How PIXAURA Can Help



We've spent years in the digital marketing field, and can help you with developing your strategy, both in times of normalcy and times of crisis. We use SEO, Google Ads, social media and website design to build your brand exposure and score you more leads, sales, and traffic. Reach out to us today if your business needs assistance navigating their marketing during a crisis - or anytime else!

# The CARES Act: What You Need to Know
> Our nationâ€™s lawmakers have agreed and passed a $2 trillion stimulus bill called the CARES Act. The legislation provides relief to American citizens and businesses who have been negatively affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. Hereâ€™s what you need to know.&hellip;

Full Content:
Our nationâ€™s lawmakers have agreed and passed a $2 trillion stimulus bill called the CARES Act. The legislation provides relief to American citizens and businesses who have been negatively affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. Hereâ€™s what you need to know.



For Individuals



Direct Payments



Firstly, the Act stipulates that all Americans will receive a one-time rebate of up to $1200 ($2400 for married couples.) Additionally, parents will receive an additional payment of $500 per child. However, the rebate will be reduced for individuals making between $75,000 and $100,000 ($150,000 and $200,000 if married.)  No checks will be issued to those with incomes above these thresholds.&nbsp;



Unemployment



The CARES Act provides $250 billion for an extended unemployment insurance program. The act dramatically expands eligibility, and the program will pay individuals $600/week for 4 months on top of state program payments. Even more, the act extends state benefits from 26 to 39 weeks. Additionally, the act makes eligible the self-employed, gig economy workers, and contractors for this benefit.



Retirement Funds



The CARES Act waives the 10% penalty on early withdrawals. However, the amount withdrawn is still subject to tax, but that tax burden can be spread across three years. Optionally, citizens may repay the amount withdrawn over the same three years, allowing for contributions in excess of the typical annual limits. Additionally, 401k participants may take loans up to $100,000. Previously, the limit was $50,000.



COVID Testing/Treatment



The Act covers the costs of testing for COVID-19, as well as any potential vaccine or treatment developed.



Student Loans



The act allows for the suspension of payments, interest, and garnishment on federal student loans through September 30, 2020.



For Businesses



Small Businesses



The Act dedicates $350 billion to small businesses (under 500 employees) to prevent layoffs and closures. However, the portion of a companyâ€™s loan used for payroll, interest, mortgage, rent, and utilities can be forgiven if employee payroll is maintained. This is the Paycheck Protection Program.




Paycheck Protection Program




Large Corporations



The CARES Act earmarks a $500 billion stimulus to large corporations. Unlike the small business program, businesses must pay these loans back within 5 years - they cannot be forgiven.



Corporate Tax&nbsp;



Businesses can choose to delay their quarterly tax payments until October 15, 2020.



Payroll Tax Relief



Businesses can delay the employer half of the payroll tax for 2020. Instead, companies can spread these payments across 2021 and 2022.







At a time of great difficulty, it is refreshing to see our lawmakers put away their differences and come together to create legislation designed to see us through this crisis!

Important notes:
- Published on: 2020-03-31 22:21:54
- Category: Posts
- [The CARES Act: What You Need to Know](https://www.pixaura.com/what-you-need-to-know-about-the-cares-act/): Our nationâ€™s lawmakers have agreed and passed a $2 trillion stimulus bill called the CARES Act. The legislation provides relief to American citizens and businesses who have been negatively affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. Hereâ€™s what you need to know.&hellip;

-------------------------

# Don't Stop Advertising! Now More than Ever.
> In these uncertain times, it can be challenging to know how to market effectively. &nbsp;This is a scary time for many businesses, and there are important decisions to be made. You need revenue, but if you stop digital marketing, itâ€™s&hellip;

Full Content:
In these uncertain times, it can be challenging to know how to market effectively. &nbsp;This is a scary time for many businesses, and there are important decisions to be made. You need revenue, but if you stop digital marketing, itâ€™s hard to make sales. If you continue advertising, how do you ensure your message is received favorably by customers who are likely worried about their own situations?



For many, the inclination is to stop, sit back and see what happens. But don't stop advertising! Marketing is a long game. Customers are more likely to make a purchase the more times they're exposed to your brand or product. Youâ€™ve spent a lot of time building your brand and reputation. Youâ€™ve determined your target audience and formulated a strategy. Donâ€™t throw away that time and effort. More people are online than ever - make sure youâ€™re seen.



Facebook Advertising



In today's climate, Facebook is beyond important - it's necessary. Facebook ads allow us to target audiences in incredibly precise fashion. Right now, many of your competitors are cutting back on advertising. To boot, the costs are dropping, and simultaneously, more eyes are on your ads. For brands that maintain or grow their ad spending, thatâ€™s marketing nirvana. The ads you run now could have a better ROI and stronger impact than youâ€™ve experienced before.



But where should you begin? Letâ€™s start with the important stuff: if your current ads are working, donâ€™t stop them! But if theyâ€™re tone deaf, or a bit insensitive for a crisis, pull them and get back to the drawing board. This situation is NOT a gimmicky marketing opportunity. If you want to run a sale, go ahead - but donâ€™t link it to this pandemic. If your coupon code is â€œcovid-19â€, go ahead and prepare for the backlash of offended customers (who will likely never come back.)



Instead, focus on how you can be of service. If your product solves a problem, great! Tell people how it can help them. Maybe offer flexible payment options or amend your typical contract language. People need to know youâ€™re after more than just their money. If you can be sensitive to what others are experiencing, and find opportunities to cooperate and collaborate, youâ€™ll go beyond building a customer - youâ€™ll build a community.&nbsp;



Pixaura's Advertising Expertise



At Pixaura, we've helped numerous companies with their digital marketing strategies. If you're looking to start or continue advertising on Facebook, or any other platform, let us know how we can help. We hope to see all of you survive and even thrive through this crisis. But remember: don't stop advertising!

You need revenue, but if you stop digital marketing, itâ€™s&hellip;

# Google Business Reviews & COVID-19
> The Coronavirus continues to grind the world to a halt. Not even Google business reviews have been able to escape its effects. As of last week, Google business reviews are no longer being published to business accounts. This came largely&hellip;

Full Content:
The Coronavirus continues to grind the world to a halt. Not even Google business reviews have been able to escape its effects.



As of last week, Google business reviews are no longer being published to business accounts. This came largely in response to ill-informed or malicious reviews about businesses not being open during their typical hours. In other cases, users were fraudulently claiming that someone had contracted COVID-19 at an establishment. 



Rest assured, Google's short-staffed teams are still hard at work. New listings, claims, and verifications for health-related businesses have been deemed top priority. You can expect delays for these types of updates for other businesses.



However, profile edits are still a priority. Whether you're open, offering special hours or experiencing a temporary closure, Google employees will be manually reviewing and updating these types of changes as soon as possible. So be sure to keep your business profile up to date if anything has changed during COVID.



In the meantime, Google posts are still functioning - use them to communicate with your customers! And don't worry, reviews that post during this time will be published when things get back to normal. If you need help building your reputation, Pixaura is here to help with that.

Important notes:

Not even Google business reviews have been able to escape its effects. As of last week, Google business reviews are no longer being published to business accounts. This came largely&hellip;

# Covid-19 Small Businesses Disaster Relief Loan
> SBA Disaster Assistance in Response to the Coronavirus The U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) is offering low-interest federal disaster loans to small businesses. These loans will supply working capital to businesses suffering from the economic effects of COVID-19. The SBA&hellip;

Full Content:
SBA Disaster Assistance in Response to the Coronavirus







The U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) is offering low-interest federal disaster loans to small businesses. These loans will supply working capital to businesses suffering from the economic effects of COVID-19. The SBA will issue under its own authority an Economic Injury Disaster Loan declaration.



Apply For Economic Injury Disaster Loan Program



The SBA will work directly with state Governors to provide targeted, low-interest loans to small businesses and non-profits that have been severely impacted by the Coronavirus (COVID-19). The SBA program can provides small businesses with loans up to $2 million. These loans will provide vital economic support to help overcome the temporary loss of revenue.&nbsp;



Find more information on the SBAâ€™s Economic Injury Disaster Loans at - SBA.gov/Disaster.



Guidance for Businesses and Employers to Plan and Respond to Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)



Health and government officials are working together to maintain the safety, security, and health of the American people. Small businesses are encouraged to keep their employees, customers, and themselves healthy.



Help with your Web Design or Development



Pixaura will help any company that needs to update their site with COVID-19 information free of charge. Let us know if you need web design or development help.

Important notes:
- Published on: 2020-03-16 17:44:13
- Category: Posts

These loans will supply working capital to businesses suffering from the economic effects of COVID-19. The SBA&hellip;

Full Content:
This time is going to be difficult for all businesses to survive, but weâ€™re here with you. Pixaura will be offering, at no charge, web design/development services associated with the COVID19 / Coronavirus.&nbsp;

What's Your Status?



Notify your existing and new customers with your current capacity, services offered, delays, etc...



Keep Your Business Safe



Share important COVID19 safety tips with your customers and employees on your site.&nbsp;



For example, 



Our company will provide disinfectant wipes, promote social distancing, provide masks and gloves, etcâ€¦ to keep our employees safe.











1 HANDS Wash them often



2 ELBOW Cough into it



3 FACE Don't touch it



4 FEET Stay more than 3ft apart



5 FEEL sick? Stay home



Service Calls and Appointments



If youâ€™re a service company, ensure that your employees will not be entering a customerâ€™s house if they are experiencing a fever, shortness of breath, or dry cough. Safety is the number one priority.&nbsp;



Have your employees wear a mask and gloves to perform service. All surfaces should be wiped down with disinfectant.&nbsp;&nbsp;



Postpone all non-critical service calls until a later date if possible.



Respond Quickly to Refunds



If asked for a refund, respond quicklyâ€¦ donâ€™t delay, these customers will appreciate the gesture and be there when you need them.&nbsp;



Be Transparent



Tell your employees and customers that you will be doing everything to keep them and our community safe.&nbsp;



Notify Customers through your Site and Social Media



Keep your customers in the loop with all of your procedures and precautions. Put your messages on your website and social media.&nbsp;



COVID19 Page or FAQ information

Full Content:

Benefits



Think of CallRail as caller ID + call forwarding, but amped up to help you convert those leads, both now and in the future. Youâ€™ll know whoâ€™s calling, from where, and even what kind of device theyâ€™re calling from. Consider how valuable this information will be. No more guessing at your audience. No more guessing which platforms are most suited to your marketing.



A more significant feature is the ability to correlate those incoming calls with specific marketing campaigns. Imagine running several different ads across several different channels, and still knowing exactly which ad placement motivated the customer to call. With CallRail, this is a reality.

# Don't Just Advertise - Engage With Customers!
> Letâ€™s face it: people donâ€™t like ads.Â  Weâ€™re bombarded with them every day in every place.Â  Weâ€™ve learned to look past them, ignore them, or at best, skim their content.Â But there's a better way. Don't just advertise to your customers&hellip;

Full Content:
Letâ€™s face it: people donâ€™t like ads.Â  Weâ€™re bombarded with them every day in every place.Â  Weâ€™ve learned to look past them, ignore them, or at best, skim their content.Â But there's a better way. Don't just advertise to your customers - engage with them!



It isnâ€™t all bad news.Â  Customer feedback about what they donâ€™t like tells us a lot about what they do want.Â  And what they want is for you to engage with them.Â  Don't just advertise - here are 3 ways to connect with your customers.



Reshare



Some of the best content will come from your fans.&nbsp; If someone is praising you, share it!&nbsp; If someone is using your product or service, feature it!&nbsp; Few campaigns are more effective than voice-of-customer data.&nbsp; Before sharing, remember to ask permission and give them credit.&nbsp; 



Bonus: resharing your fansâ€™ content might just lead to more user content to share.&nbsp; Not a bad cycle to find yourself in!



Respond



Customers want to be heard, whether about a product suggestion or their experience with your business.&nbsp; Show them thereâ€™s real people behind your account by answering them, especially through social media.



Donâ€™t respond to just the good reviews; learn to see the negatives as opportunities for excellent customer service!&nbsp; Consumers pay attention to how you handle bad reviews, and according to Forbes, 45% of people will still visit businesses with negative reviews when they are answered in a concerned and helpful fashion.



Reward



Loyalty perks exist because they work. Today, many business are rewarding their fans through social media contests.&nbsp; When these giveaways involve sharing your content, youâ€™re leveraging your existing customer community and boosting brand awareness beyond your own audience.&nbsp; This, in turn, can gain you additional viewers for your future campaigns.&nbsp; 



Just remember to make sure your rewards are relevant - a golf course giveaway should be golf-related, right?




https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IW-rJ7RDdlM




Advertising



But what about ads? Well the title of this article is "don't JUST advertise" after all.  Ads still and will always matter, and the old rules still apply - know your audience, tell them how you can help them, and be honest about the benefits youâ€™re offering. Finally, make sure youâ€™re sending them to a dedicated post-click landing page. Don't waste effort enticing them without linking to exactly where you can convert the click to a sale!

# You Started a Business. Congratulations!
> You Brought Your Dream to Life. Now What? You had an idea and you made it happen. You started a business! It took a lot to get here. But to paraphrase Robert Frost, youâ€™ve got miles to go before youâ€™ll&hellip;

Full Content:
You Brought Your Dream to Life. Now What?



You had an idea and you made it happen. You started a business! It took a lot to get here. But to paraphrase Robert Frost, youâ€™ve got miles to go before youâ€™ll get a full nightâ€™s sleep again. Or something like that. Truth is, youâ€™ll work late often, and turn around to be greeted by an early morning too. Youâ€™ll be challenged, and youâ€™ll be rewarded. Youâ€™ll have ups, and youâ€™ll have downs.



Weâ€™re rooting for more ups than downs. To make that happen, you need customers. To get customers, you need to build awareness of your brand, and in todayâ€™s business climate, that will be most successful when approached digitally.



Digital marketing strategies are NOT a one-size-fits-all scenario. Your companyâ€™s customized plan will be affected by your goals, product, industry, target audience and more. However, there are certain commonalities every business will need to account for in developing their digital campaigns.



Target Acquired&nbsp;



You canâ€™t market effectively if you donâ€™t know which customers you want. Users wonâ€™t organically find you very often - youâ€™ve got to go to them, and that requires knowing who they are and where they spend their time. Identifying your customers and developing a strategy all starts with data. Donâ€™t try to reach everyone; market to your target audience instead of landing your message with irrelevant groups unlikely to respond.



Your Presence is Requested



You need a website. (Stating the obvious.) A well-designed site improves your visibility, but needs to do more than just be informative. A multi-functional site gives users the brand interaction theyâ€™re after, while generating more leads and more sales.



Put Yourself Out There 



Social media is more important and complex than ever. Effective social marketing increases your exposure, generates traffic, and develops loyal customers. Potential customers are using many social platforms, so meet them head-on with a comprehensive strategy that engages them across various media.



Don't Get Lost in the Crowd



Search Engine Optimization is a must for your business. A professional audit will elevate your company when users search keywords related to your industry. This not only increases traffic, but gives the impression that you are an established company with a good reputation. Paid search marketing is a cost-effective strategy with an historically healthy ROI.



Building your customer base is an uphill climb, but a consistent digital marketing strategy can help increase your visibility. When starting a business, the right tactics will help you stand out from the crowd. Get out there and tell the world what you have to offer. &nbsp;



Not sure how to start? Pixaura can help.

# Hire Professional Website Designers. Skip the DIY.
> Why Is No One Coming to my Website? You went with the template over the professionally designed website. Youâ€™ve created your mind-blowing website. Itâ€™s beautiful. Itâ€™s telling your brandâ€™s story perfectly. You did it for free on Squarespace. No one&hellip;

Full Content:
Why Is No One Coming to my Website?
You went with the template over the professionally designed website. Youâ€™ve created your mind-blowing website. Itâ€™s beautiful. Itâ€™s telling your brandâ€™s story perfectly. You did it for free on Squarespace. No one is coming.
When it comes to websites, free isnâ€™t always better. In fact, it's never better.
Your website may be head-turning in the looks department, but if no one sees it then does it even matter? Here are a few things professional website designers can help with that free website hosting sites lack.
Four Reasons to Use a Professional Website Developer
Schemas
Google crawls websites to see what theyâ€™re all about and give users the most relevant results. Schema explains, in code, to Google what each section of your site is about. By providing explicit clues in the coding, you make this easy for Google -- upping your chances of being ranked higher in the search results. The right pro is knowledgeable in structured data guidelines, knowing what is required and/or recommended for structured data and Google. Wix isnâ€™t going to have your back on this.
Responsive design
This means that your web pages look fabulous on whatever device the consumer is using. Whether it's a laptop, tablet, or phone, it needs to be functional on all of them. Otherwise, the user will almost automatically head to your competitorâ€™s site. Professional website design makes sure that isnâ€™t happening, and that your website provide a high quality user experience (UX.)
Code
Your code needs to be written the right way for search engines to collect the data they need quickly and easily. This is important for ranking higher on the results pages. Only a website developer will have full control over this, giving your website and business the best shot at landing on the top SERPsÂ (search engine result pages).Â 
Cool stuff you canâ€™t do on your own
Donâ€™t be limited by a mass-produced template. By building a website with functionality tailored for your business, a website developer helps with usability, ease of navigation, and just cool extras you canâ€™t do any other way. If users are able to navigate your e-commerce website or online store easily, they are more likely to purchase your product or services. Also, a professional can create whatever you want for your website. But the code is the limit when it comes to features. With a professional, you wonâ€™t be hindered by your template.Â 
Free always seems like a good idea until taking a closer look. Youâ€™re spending time, money, blood, sweat and tears on your business, donâ€™t skimp when it comes to your website and use a free host. Thereâ€™s a reason itâ€™s free.

# Ignoring Online Reviews? Youâ€™re Doing it Wrong
> 97% of Customers Read Online Reviews When was the last time you bought something without reading a review? Restaurant or roofer, dentist or car, potential customers are not purchasing without checking reviews first. And why would they? With an array&hellip;

Full Content:
97% of Customers Read Online Reviews
When was the last time you bought something without reading a review? Restaurant or roofer, dentist or car, potential customers are not purchasing without checking reviews first. And why would they? With an array of choices at their fingertips, theyâ€™re not just picking the first name in the phone book anymore. Everyone can get personal recommendations in a matter of seconds. If youâ€™re ignoring online reviews, you are risking catastrophic damage to your business. Youâ€™ve spent time, money, sweat, and tears growing your brand, donâ€™t drop the ball with online reviews.
Letâ€™s look at the numbers
97% of consumers read online reviews for local businesses, and a staggering 97% of those people read the business's response to the reviews. Did you get that? 97%! Itâ€™s pretty clear that people who care about reviews also care if the business is actively responding to them.Â 
Youâ€™ve got them. Donâ€™t lose them.
Itâ€™s loads easier to retain a customer than to gain a new one. Think about the time, effort, and money it takes to get someone to hear about your business. To not only know who you are but actually convince them to check you out and spend their hard-earned dollars on you over the thousands of other choices. Thereâ€™s a reason marketing is a business - itâ€™s hard work! If they had a negative experience and you ignore them, you most likely will not only lose them as a customer, but risk their bad experience spreading to more and more people. When the 82% of consumers who are reading online reviews comes across that ignored bad review, chances are youâ€™ll lose them too. Youâ€™ve come this far. Donâ€™t lose them over a review.
Youâ€™ve convinced me. Now what?
Be an active participant. Pay attention to and monitor your online reviews on as many sites as you can. Respond to every single review you can find, positive or negative. Thank a loyal customer for their positive review and youâ€™ve locked someone in for life. Respond to a negative review to let the person know you care, and everyone sees you're an invested business owner. Itâ€™s not rocket science. You can do it. If you don't have the time, we can do it for you.

# Your Marketing Campaign? People Hate It.
> What Not to Do In Your Next Marketing Campaign Itâ€™s not you. Oh wait, it definitely is. Think you know what youâ€™re doing when it comes to your do-it-yourself marketing campaign? Youâ€™re probably doing it wrong. Consumers think that they&hellip;

Full Content:
What Not to Do In Your Next Marketing Campaign
Itâ€™s not you. Oh wait, it definitely is. Think you know what youâ€™re doing when it comes to your do-it-yourself marketing campaign? Youâ€™re probably doing it wrong. Consumers think that they hate marketing, when what they really hate are your annoying strategies. Attract consumers with what works and stay away from these common blunders.
1. Targeting Everyone
Thereâ€™s nothing more annoying than a company continuously popping up on a screen over and over, especially when what they're selling isnâ€™t relevant to the consumer. As a company, youâ€™re turning off potential future customers by annoying them when they donâ€™t need you. If you do this, chances are when they do need you, theyâ€™ll likely go somewhere else. Youâ€™re also wasting your resources. Keep track of that ROI (return on investment) and target where it works.
2. Avoiding Social Media
You may not be getting a ton of leads from Facebook but that doesnâ€™t mean you can slack. When a user wants to find you, they need to be able to find you. Whether on Google, Instagram or Facebook, there is nothing more frustrating to a consumer than putting in the effort to look you up and youâ€™re nowhere to be found. You donâ€™t have to be investing a ton of resources but be present and active on as many platforms as you can. If a consumer canâ€™t find you, they will move on to someone they can.
3. Not Responding to Comments
You may think youâ€™re off the hook after putting out your killer social and blog posts, but youâ€™ve still got things to do. Consumers want to interact with brands. When they are interacting with your posts, they expect a response. Itâ€™s great to have fans and when a brand is taking the time and responding to a consumer individually they get so pumped and chances are youâ€™ll have a loyal customer for a long time. If youâ€™re not reviewing and responding, consumers get offended and may take a break from your brand or move on all together.
4. Spamming Your Customers
Stop reaching out to consumers unless youâ€™ve actually got something to say. Quality over quantity folks or you will be promptly snoozed/hidden/unfollowed. Make sure what youâ€™re putting out there is worthy of your consumerâ€™s time. Make it relevant, entertaining and helpful. If itâ€™s not meeting these criteria, then skip it. You donâ€™t need a post everyday if itâ€™s pointless.
5. Not Using a Call to Action
Sometimes you have to spell it out. Want your consumer to be taking advantage of a sale? Contacting you for your services? Spell it out and make it easy on them. Post links, create imaging that visually communicates what youâ€™re pushing. Do as much of the work FOR them as you can. In that spirit, make sure youâ€™re following these tips or if you want us to do the work for you, contact us here.Â  ;)

# Faith, Trust, and a bit of Pixie Dust
> pixÂ·ie dust noun a substance or influence with an apparently magical effect that brings great success or luck. For example, "the folks who live there still seem to believe that they've been sprinkled with pixie dust." At Pixaura, we like&hellip;

Full Content:
pixÂ·ie dust noun



a substance or influence with an apparently magical effect that brings great success or luck. For example, "the folks who live there still seem to believe that they've been sprinkled with pixie dust."



At Pixaura, we like to think we have the magic dust to sprinkle on your brand and bring success. For your enjoyment, here is some fun information. 



â€œAll it takes is faith and trust... Oh! And something I forgot: Dust. Just a little bit of pixie dust.â€â€•Peter Pan











How Do You Use It? 



Pixie Dust&nbsp;is a crafting material dropped by Pixies. It creates Greater Healing Potions and Holy Water, the latter of which spreads The Hallow and other Hallow-related objects. It produces a glow and light when Pixies drop this item or if it is thrown on the ground. -Fandom



What Color is Pixie Dust?



In its common appearance,&nbsp;it&nbsp;is nothing more than a golden, sparkling powder. Usually, this&nbsp;dust&nbsp;comes from special blue&nbsp;dust&nbsp;which replenishes the supply. As a golden&nbsp;color, it enables pixies to fly. "Happy thoughts" are worthless without it! Nevertheless, we're going to keep thinking positive! -Disney Fandom



The featured image is a print by Rebecca Jenkins.



Shoot us an email and we'll send some fairies your way.

# Four Digital Strategies You Need to Use
> You Canâ€™t Run a Successful Business Without These Four Digital Marketing Tactics Companies without digital strategies are often drifting, aimlessly through the search engine world, consistently shoved out of the way and trampled by focused brands who are utilizing every&hellip;

Full Content:
You Canâ€™t Run a Successful Business Without These Four Digital Marketing Tactics
Companies without digital strategies are often drifting, aimlessly through the search engine world, consistently shoved out of the way and trampled by focused brands who are utilizing every strategy within their reach. Donâ€™t be that company! There are tools out there just waiting to be harnessed to amplify your company. If you are a business there is no excuse to not be using them:
1. Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
Search engines WANT to be able to find you. Throw them a bone! If youâ€™re a perfect match for a consumer Google wants them to find you. If they canâ€™t find you, youâ€™re missing that connection and that personâ€™s business. 
SEO is the process of gaining free, organic website traffic. Free being the key word! But anything that is free means competition. Youâ€™re going to have to work for this. Search engine algorithms are determining who is showing up first. And letâ€™s face it, no one is browsing past the first page, so do everything you can to snag those coveted spots. Search engines will never give away their algorithm secrets but there are some across the board things you can be doing to up your chances of showing up. 
Creating quality content that is purposeful and relevant. Using great keywords when appropriate. Updating content regularly. Building an easily crawlable website. Quick site loading time. Creating meaningful URLs. Linking to trusted authorities. Making sure your site is being shared by social channels. Writing gripping meta descriptions. Giving users a secure connection. 
This stuff is free. You can do it. You should be doing it.
2. Content Marketing
Itâ€™s not all about you. Consumers are wanting to follow and purchase from companies that they feel a connection with. Itâ€™s not all about what you do, your products, your history (well, a little bit). Becoming an industry expert and promoting important industry content is how you snag those long-term customers. When brainstorming blogs and social posts sprinkle in industry news and topics. Consumers will keep coming back for the info theyâ€™re interested in, creating a relationship with your brand and leading to long-term customers.
3. Pay-Per-Click Marketing (PPC)
PPC basically means that you pay a small fee for every click from a consumer. The most popular PPC tool is Google Ads (formerly Google Adwords). If you create an awesome campaign, you appear above the organic search results. Is your mouth watering over this prime position? It should be. Donâ€™t be fooled into thinking you can throw some money at this and start appearing first in searches. A lot goes into creating successful PPC campaigns, so invest your time and resources. Selecting the right keywords, organizing campaigns and ad groups and setting up successful landing pages are all a must. Once everything is working together smoothly, expect to see results.
4. Review Management
Itâ€™s been proven most shoppers check out online reviews before making a purchase. Think you can just bury your head in the sand and ignore this part of owning a successful company? Nope. People will be out there reviewing your business left and right and you need to be engaged. The negative reviewers expect a response, the positive reviewers expect to be acknowledged and those who are browsing expect to see an engaged business that is responding to reviews. Often times only those who have a negative experience will leave reviews. Encourage a more balanced view by reaching out to satisfied past clients and customers. You can do your best to respond to reviews by making sure that youâ€™re monitoring the most important sites and channels in your industry or you can outsource and hire a company to do it all for you.
Itâ€™s time to get into the game and start competing with the big boys. If youâ€™re not utilizing these digital strategies youâ€™re not doing your best work.

# The Right To Be Forgotten
> The Right To Be Forgotten. What is it and What Does it Mean for Your Business? Donâ€™t pretend you havenâ€™t done it. We all Google ourselves, but what if your results keep turning up something you donâ€™t want everyone to&hellip;

Full Content:
The Right To Be Forgotten. What is it and What Does it Mean for Your Business?
Donâ€™t pretend you havenâ€™t done it. We all Google ourselves, but what if your results keep turning up something you donâ€™t want everyone to know? Future employers seeing debt you used to owe or embarrassing affiliations from when you were a minor. Do you have the right to be forgotten? How do you combat negative press when the right to be forgotten hasnâ€™t made it to the U.S.? What does this mean for businesses?
Background
In 2014 the European Court of Justice (similar to our supreme court), ruled that the right to be forgotten is a human right, when Mario Costeja GonzÃ¡lez sought to remove search results mentioning his own personal debt. At this point the European Union and Argentina are the only ones that have legally put the right to be forgotten into practice. If there is potentially damaging information about an individual online, individuals have the right to request that search engines remove those URLs from their database. Here in the United States, where freedom of speech reigns supreme, we are far from having this policy implemented.Â 
The Good. The Bad.
At first glance you may be thinking, hell yeah! Now I canâ€™t rid the internet of my embarrassing first profile pics and Twitter rants about past jobs I hated. Upon closer inspection this ability would allow people to rewrite history and limit public access to knowledge. While the right to be forgotten would go a long way to protect people from being associated with things like crimes they were never convicted of or an angry exâ€™s attempt to damage a reputation, proceeding carefully is a must to protect access to information.
What Does This Mean for Businesses?
The right to be forgotten shows us how powerful an online reputation is when nations are ruling that negative results should be removed from search engines. As a business owner you come across negative results about your business all the time. Itâ€™s just a part of the game. People love ranting online. We all wish we could take those negative online reviews and make them disappear. While this is a pipe dream, there are things you can do to combat these negative results.
What To Do
Make sure you are responding to every review about your business, both positive and negative. Itâ€™s easy to get frustrated and ignore a negative review, or take positive reviews for granted, but responding to reviews is showing that you are an engaged and caring business. You are able to hopefully solve a problem with a response to a negative review and leave a positive reviewer with a warm and fuzzy feeling after shooting them a thank you.
Seek out reviews. Online reviews can be one sided. People will leave reviews only when they have a negative experience, and simply leave happy without alerting the internet (gasp) when they have an awesome experience. Seeking out positive reviews means giving potential customers a more realistic view of your business.Â 
Brag about yourself. Take those positive reviews and amplify them. Using positive reviews in website copy, social posts and blog posts means that you are multiplying their positive effect when it comes to your online reputation.
If there is one thing we can learn from the right to be forgotten it is that online reputation is important. Donâ€™t let your business suffer from negative reviews. We can help.

Important notes:
- Published on: 2019-09-13 14:57:48

Donâ€™t pretend you havenâ€™t done it. We all Google ourselves, but what if your results keep turning up something you donâ€™t want everyone to&hellip;

# Willie Nelson Wednesday at Pixaura
> Our first music tribute was Stevie Wonder Wednesday. And we're following up with an American icon, Willie Nelson! Born in Texas in 1933, Willie's life started with some foreshadowing of the eccentric stories to come. Born close to midnight, his&hellip;

Full Content:
Our first music tribute was Stevie Wonder Wednesday. And we're following up with an American icon, Willie Nelson! 



Born in Texas in 1933, Willie's life started with some foreshadowing of the eccentric stories to come. Born close to midnight, his birth certificate lists April 29th. But no one knows if it was actually April 30th yet! His grandparents, both of whom studied with the Chicago Music Institute, raised Willie, helping spur the young boy's interest in music. 



He wrote his first song at age 7, and performed with Bob Wills, the inventor of western swing, at just 13 years old. Before his music career began in earnest, he worked as a cotton picker, DJ, bible salesman and saddle maker, amongst other odd jobs and short stint in the Air Force.



Nelson was one of the central figures in the rise of "outlaw country." This subgenre, largely a response to the conservative Nashville studios, erupted as the careers of artists like Kris Kristofferson, Waylon Jennings, Johnny Cash, and Merle Haggard took off.We're sure you've got work to do today. Meanwhile, enjoy some classics on this playlist on Spotify. Or if you've got the time, check out this wild list of Willie Nelson facts. Some of these are hard to believe, and some fit perfectly with his legendary outlaw persona.




https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R7f189Z0v0Y




"Trigger" Willie Nelsonâ€™s  Guitar

Born close to midnight, his&hellip;

Seventy-five percent of our investment now are in digital social media influencers, and theyâ€™re revealing to be highly productive,â€ CEO Fabrizio Freda says.Â 
Did you hear that? Most of their budget is going to digital! Investing your money where growth is happening, yields returns for your company. You may think that slapping up a website is good enough. It isnâ€™t. As a business owner one of your jobs is to cultivate and nurture your online presence. If you donâ€™t, get ready to wilt behind the businesses that are shining bright online.
Okay, so youâ€™re not Ã‰stee Lauder and youâ€™re not paying millions of dollars to influencers but recognizing where major players are spending time and resources should give your clarity about the importance of digital presence. Work your Google Ads, keep your social media game tight, donâ€™t skimp on blogs, monitor your online reviews, update your website content regularly and reach out to influencers. # Your Digital Marketing FAQ's Answered!
> You have burning digital marketing FAQ's. We have expert answers. Â  Can I just do my own SEO (search engine optimization)? You CAN, but chances are a professional will do a better job. We know all of the ins and&hellip;

Full Content:
You have burning digital marketing FAQ's. We have expert answers.
Â 
Can I just do my own SEO (search engine optimization)?
You CAN, but chances are a professional will do a better job. We know all of the ins and outs of the SEO game. Itâ€™s what we do. You may have your meta description and content game down but are you optimizing page speed and adding in your H1, H2, etc. content tags? There are so many pieces to the puzzle. We make sure youâ€™re addressing the whole picture so consumers can find your site.
Can I just use a website template?
This is totally an option but letâ€™s look at the pros and cons. Pros: Itâ€™s quick. Itâ€™s easy. Anyone can do it. Cons: A template may not meet the ideal needs of your specific business. Like, if you sell online youâ€™ll have different needs than a non-profit. Itâ€™s not optimized for search engines. Templates are made to be pretty and easy, not necessarily be functioning and updating to give you the best SEO. As your business grows your template website may not be able to handle the needed pages. If you own a successful business your Squarespace site may not last you long. Working with professionals from the beginning means a website thatâ€™s working for you now and working for the long game.
Do my online reviews really matter?
YES. Time and time again we see business neglecting this key factor in nurturing their growing business. Search engines are taking online reviews into account, so itâ€™s one more way to fight your way to the top of the SERPs (search engine result pages). Surprised? You shouldnâ€™t be. Google works to give its users the best results and since users love online reviews, of course search engines are showing them some love. Donâ€™t think one bad review can hurt? Youâ€™re wrong. 95% of consumers say a bad online review deterred them from using a business. You need to be cultivating good online reviews, making sure youâ€™re showing up on the right review sites and always responding to negative reviews. Donâ€™t let this huge part of your business fall through the cracks.
Why Google Ads?
The ultimate goal of digital marketing is to appear at the top of the SERPs organically. Want a shortcut? Google Ads it. In short Google Ads places you above organic search results. You can tailor and target specific audiences to capitalize on your ideal demographics, all leading to more traffic and sales. Our experts do Google Ads all day long and know how to word and manage your campaigns for success.
What type of content works best?
The answer to this question is tailored for each specific client and includes a mix of strategies. One thing to keep in mind is that super, salesy content tends to turn consumers off. If youâ€™re building long-term, loyal followers focus your content on storytelling. The consumer wants to connect with businesses in a more authentic way than in the past. They want transparency and honesty. Stay away from anything too pushy. Instead, focus on your brand values, use humor when appropriate, share industry news and company culture. Build a relationship not a single sale.
Have more digital marketing FAQ's? Letâ€™s chat.Â

We're happy to announce the arrival of a new website we built for Unveil Systems.

The mixed reality technology uses the Microsoft Hololens to give emergency medical personnel a realistic training experience. Allowing existing training suites to make the most of what they already have, this technology can also be used with a TOMManikin.Â 
Realistic Training
Mixed reality also allows emergency medical students to experience training that reflects real-world scenarios. For example, they can test a patient's breathing rate, breathing symmetry, pulse, and oxygen levels. Additionally, the technology lets you customize the injuries youâ€™re seeing. This allows the student as many repetitions as needed to get desired results. To put it simply: better training means better results.
The superb technology used in the Unveil system tracks each studentâ€™s gaze to see where they are looking. The data is auto-recorded to allow more time to work on the important stuff. Also, this technology makes it possible to jump forward and backward in the patient's progression. It takes just seconds to go from the injury to long term changes. This gives the trainee more information about the decisions they made or should have made. Allowing existing training suites to make the most of what they already have, this technology can also be used with a TOMManikin.
Saving lives is serious business. Unveil upgrades any training system using some of the coolest technology weâ€™ve seen.

# Paradigms and Pixaura --- :)
> Paradigms. parÂ·aÂ·digm/ËˆperÉ™ËŒdÄ«m/Learn to pronounce noun a typical example or pattern of something; a model. "There is a new paradigm for public art in this country." Synonyms: model,&nbsp;pattern,&nbsp;example,&nbsp;standard,&nbsp;prototype,&nbsp;archetype...LINGUISTICS: a set of items that form mutually exclusive choices in particular syntactic roles.&hellip;

Full Content:
Paradigms. 



parÂ·aÂ·digm/ËˆperÉ™ËŒdÄ«m/Learn to pronounce noun



a typical example or pattern of something; a model. "There is a new paradigm for public art in this country." Synonyms: model,&nbsp;pattern,&nbsp;example,&nbsp;standard,&nbsp;prototype,&nbsp;archetype...LINGUISTICS: a set of items that form mutually exclusive choices in particular syntactic roles. For example, "English determiners form a paradigm. We can say â€œa bookâ€ or â€œhis bookâ€ but not â€œa his book.â€



A&nbsp;paradigm shift is a concept identified by the American physicist and philosopher Thomas Kuhn. It is a fundamental change in the basic concepts and experimental practices of a scientific discipline. In addition, Kuhn acknowledges having used the term "paradigms" in two different meanings.



At Pixaura, we see a paradigm shift happening online.



A.I., or Artificial Intelligence, is the future of the internet. And we're here to help put your digital aura in the minds of the different A.I. engines/brains online. Google, Facebook, LinkedIn, etc., are all making decision about ads and content display based on A.I. :) All of these brains and algorithms continue to grow more complex every day. 



Words, sentences, pages, and sites are being interpreted and *read* by A.I. But are they doing it effectively and do they understand your true meaning and intention? Also, is your content reaching the right audience in the right market? At Pixaura, when we create content for your business, we collect data to make sure your original intent is not getting lost in the A.I. mind.

Important notes:
- Published on: 2019-07-22 20:30:18
- Category: Posts
- [Paradigms and Pixaura --- :)](https://www.pixaura.com/paradigms/): Paradigms. parÂ·aÂ·digm/ËˆperÉ™ËŒdÄ«m/Learn to pronounce noun a typical example or pattern of something; a model. "There is a new paradigm for public art in this country." Synonyms: model,&nbsp;pattern,&nbsp;example,&nbsp;standard,&nbsp;prototype,&nbsp;archetype...LINGUISTICS: a set of items that form mutually exclusive choices in particular syntactic roles.&hellip;

Doctors



Contractors



Restaurants&nbsp;

Statistics about online reviews




93% of customers read online reviews.



80% of customers wonâ€™t buy from companies with bad reviews.



72% of customers trust online reviews equally to personal recommendations.



68% of customers read reviews on social networks.



90% of customers say they are influenced by positive online reviews.



A&nbsp;Harvard Business School&nbsp;study suggests restaurants could experience a 9% drop in annual revenue by losing just one star on Yelp.



97% of potential consumers read online reviews to find local businesses.



74% of consumers trust a company more if they have positive customer feedback.



60% of customers said negative reviews made them not want to use a business.



A product with 5 reviews is 270% more likely to be purchased than a product with no reviews.



Products with a review&nbsp;between 4.2-4.7&nbsp;stars do better than all 5-star reviews. Customers view these ratings as more authentic.



The first ten customer reviews are the most impactful.



Reviews from verified buyers have a greater influence on sales.



53% of travelers wonâ€™t book a hotel with no reviews.




Online reviews help your business, plain and simple.  Even negative feedback has value - potential customers respond positively when you respond to negative reviews in a helpful, accountable manner. # How To Write Title Tags That Get Clicks
> Write Title Tags Like an SEO Pro When it comes to how to write title tags for SEO (search engine optimization), writing clickable titles makes all of the difference.Â  It goes by many names: meta title, meta tag, page title,&hellip;

Full Content:
Write Title Tags Like an SEO Pro
When it comes to how to write title tags for SEO (search engine optimization), writing clickable titles makes all of the difference.Â 
It goes by many names: meta title, meta tag, page title, title tag. Itâ€™s all the same thing. Just like the title of a movie or book, this is the first thing that users see. It needs to reach out through all of the Google noise, grab their chin and give it a gentle jerk toward your incredible website.Â 
What is a Title Tag?
Donâ€™t be freaked out by the resounding importance of optimizing your titles. At its most basic level, it is simply the title of your page. This piece of code tells search engines what your page is all about, so it can give users the best results. When you Google something, this is the blue link that shows up on the SERP (search engine results page).
Why Do They Matter?
Google uses tons of signals to make up its ranking algorithm. Your title tag is one of the most important factors. Simply put, a great title tag will get you closer to the top of the SERP and give you a prime spot in coveted results real estate.Â 
Ok, youâ€™ve made it to the first results page on Google. Now that user has a whole page of websites to choose from. A catchy yet informative title ups your chances of being chosen. Your SEO strategy is not just appearing in search results (only a newbie digital marketer stops there,) but getting as many clicks as you can. This increases the odds of new customers.Â Â 
Letâ€™s Write Some Title Tags
Know your keywords.
Keywords are the words a consumer would use when searching for a business like yours. Get into their head. Think like the consumer. Do some Googling, check the results, check the related phrases and browse the results youâ€™re getting. There are tons of tools out there that you can use that claim to have the ability to find you the best keywords and this is an option too.Â 
Where your keywords go. 
It is of collective opinion that having keywords close to the beginning of the title will get you better results (Google will never tell us exactly how their algorithms work). On the other hand, your title should also flow naturally and have good readability for the user. So donâ€™t go out of your way to create an awkward title just to put a keyword first.
Rein in your length.
Itâ€™s tempting to try and throw a bunch of information and keywords into your title but Google will only show a certain number of characters and weâ€™ve moved well past keyword loading and search engines. Ideally, keep your title below 60 characters.Â 
Mix it up. 
Each of your pages should have their own unique title. Google hates repetition and itâ€™s confusing for the user and the search engine. Mix up your keywords. This gives you a better shot at showing up in multiple, related searches. Add an accurate description of what the page is and you are good to go.
Hook the user. 
The final step is using words that appeal to a user. Add in unique descriptors. Use action words such as learn, discover, try. Make sure that the user can actually do the things youâ€™re describing on that particular page. Nothing frustrates a user more than not being able to find what theyâ€™re looking for and they will abandon your website completely, for website navigation that makes sense.Â 
Now that you understand a little more how titles can affect your click through rates, take a stag at rewriting your title tags, and watch your traffic increase. Your title tag is an important SEO tool. Donâ€™t waste it.

# The One Thing You Need to Do for Successful SEO
> Weâ€™ll let you in on a little secret...the key to successful SEO When it comes to successful SEO, content will always be king. Google may tweak its ranking system regularly but it will always come back to content. If youâ€™re&hellip;

Full Content:
Weâ€™ll let you in on a little secret...the key to successful SEO
When it comes to successful SEO, content will always be king. Google may tweak its ranking system regularly but it will always come back to content. If youâ€™re phoning it in or looking for SEO shortcuts, get ready to be invisible to search engines and customers alike. Quality content is always the gold standard.
E-A-T Acronym
Expertise, authoritativeness and trustworthiness. Commit these words to memory. This acronym is key in the SEO world. These three gems continue to pop up as top players when it comes to Googleâ€™s ranking system. Want to be at the top of the search engine results pages (SERPs)? You want to hit the mark for each of these. Google wants users to feel confident in the results they are receiving when they search. Itâ€™s not just about relevancy anymore, itâ€™s about trustworthiness (no fake news!). 
How To Do It
We can go into a ton of detail here but if you want some easy things you can be doing right now to up your E-A-T score, here ya go: including author names and biographies for all content, creating trustworthy content, link only from authoritative websites, easy to find contact info, having a visible privacy policy and investing in technical security, among other things.
Authenticity
You may think that figuring out all of Googleâ€™s secrets for ranking websites and playing into their hands is going to shoot your website to the top. This used to be the case back in the day but Google is not the naive search engine it once was. It is a shrewd and grown up search engine and it does not like playing games. Every time Google adjusts its results algorithm it is aiming for one thing, to give users quality results. 
How To Do It
If you focus on cultivating and nurturing your website you ARE playing right into what Googleâ€™s hands. No tricks, no games, just giving Google what it wants. Time for a grown up relationship. Work hard to boost your brand and website through great and relevant copy, blogs that have a finger on the pulse of the industry, keywords that make sense and experts that enhance your visitor experience. Stop playing games with Google.
There are a ton of things you can do to up your SEO game. At Pixaura we will execute them all seamlessly for you. If youâ€™re tackling this on your own, this is the best place to start. Forget the tricks. If youâ€™re doing only one thing for your SEO make sure it is giving users quality content that they can trust. You canâ€™t go wrong.

# Why Online Reviews Matter
> Do Online Reviews Matter? Youâ€™re the master of your industry, youâ€™ve got your brand on lock, youâ€™re killing it in your local market. Then it happens: one bad review rears its ugly head. You're thinking an online review wonâ€™t make&hellip;

Full Content:
Do Online Reviews Matter?
Youâ€™re the master of your industry, youâ€™ve got your brand on lock, youâ€™re killing it in your local market. Then it happens: one bad review rears its ugly head. You're thinking an online review wonâ€™t make or break your business, but youâ€™re wrong. Remember how businesses used to thrive through personal recommendation and word of mouth referrals? Thatâ€™s what online reviews are today and they matter. A lot. 
Why Reviews Are Important
Everyone is reading online reviews before making their purchasing decisions. 9 out of 10 consumers read customer reviews before purchasing, and 7 out of 10 consumers are more likely to consider a business with positive reviews. Also, 90% of people claimed positive online reviews influence buying decisions, while 86 percent were influenced by negative reviews. If you donâ€™t have a handle on your online reputation youâ€™re not going to make it.
Check out how Pixaura can help your reviews
Reviews Impact Your SEO
Search engines love reviews because consumers love reviews. So it makes sense that online reviews are playing a major role in your SEO (search engine optimization). It is thought that online reviews are making up 10% of the factors considered by search engines for search result pages. Having reviews increases your websiteâ€™s likelihood of showing up when people search for your industry.
How to Get More Reviews
Now that you know how important online reviews are, it's time to start working to acquire these positive reviews. Making opportunities available to your customers that are easy, clear and take just moments of their time is a good place to start. However, while many review platforms encourage review solicitation, some sites, like Yelp, will shut it down if they detect anything fishy. Knowing the ins and outs is what itâ€™s all about so you donâ€™t get shut out of major platforms that can majorly impact your business. Good news! Pixaura's marketing masters already know all of the nitty gritty and will do this for you.
The Right Review Sites
But wait, itâ€™s not just about the number of positive reviews or your star rating. You want your business to appear on review sites that are most impactful for your industry. If you are a local business like a restaurant you obviously need to be on Yelp. If youâ€™re a wedding planner, you better make sure that youâ€™re showing up on The Knot. Did you know that some websites hoard reviews for their site alone, while other sites allow search engines to tap into the data? This may leave your head spinning, but you can rest easy knowing Pixaura'sÂ pros will make sure youâ€™re showing up in the right places and maximize your online reviews.
The Cost of Negative Reviews
94% of consumers say an online review has convinced them to avoid a business, and 4 out of 5 consumers have changed their mind about using a business after reading a negative review. Statistics this close to 100% better be at the forefront of your business-managing mind. This much trust in online reviews means those negative reviews are costing you when they go unaddressed. 
Keeping tabs on all of these reviews may seem like a handful but itâ€™s an unavoidable part of running a business. Negative reviews should be acknowledged and addressed to combat their negative influence. When a business is flawlessly handling a complaint it goes a long way toward building a relationship of authenticity with the consumer and encouraging use despite the negative review. Internally, donâ€™t let negative reviews rile you up - use them as a jumping off point to discuss improvements. 
We bet you never thought online reviews were this important. With everything else that goes into running a business your online management may be taking a back seat. This is a fatal mistake. Youâ€™re worrying about inventory, staffing, costs, ROI, product development and all of the tough stuff that comes with being a badass business owner, but dedicating some of your resources to online reputation management will pay off, big time.
Check out how Pixaura can help your reviews

SEO
